DataElement.preferredName: Single Clinical Trial Protocol  Agent Unrelated Hematologic Modification Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the change or deviation due to reasons unrelated to the blood and blood-forming organs from the standard administration of one therapeutic agent (substance given to alter course of disease) from that described by documented procedures for a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Single Clinical Trial Protocol  Agent Unrelated Hematologic Modification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a change or deviation due to reasons unrelated to the blood and blood-forming organs from the standard administration of one therapeutic agent (substance given to alter course of disease) from that described by documented procedures for a clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Not accompanied by another or others.:An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.

A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Property.preferredDefinition:
Unrelated; not connected or associated e.g. by kinship.:Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming
organs.:alteration or modification.

Concepts.definition: Not connected or associated e.g. by kinship.
Pertaining to or related to the blood and blood-forming organs.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: all administered components updated to comply with ISO 11179 standard

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field for defining quantities of therapy or treatment.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

DataElement.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
